timeline.bodyText:
Should this ever happen? If we have a hash on our PrivacyGroupHeadBlockMap, we should always find the state root for it, should we?
Maybe this should throw an error.
timeline.author: lucassaldanha

replies.bodyText: You are right. Copied that from the original method without questioning it. Will fix both!
replies.author: pinges

timeline.bodyText: I don't think I understand why we need this if statement. Is this because for each new block we need a new PrivateMetadataUpdater, and not reuse a previous one?
timeline.author: lucassaldanha

replies.bodyText:
I wasn't hundred percent sure either. But for every block that we are processing we do need a new PrivateMetadataUpdater. We are instantiating one in this block processor that is wrapping the public block processor.
If there was an updater passed in I thought that something must have gone wrong ...
replies.author: pinges

timeline.bodyText: At this point, has Besu already commit the changes in public world state?
timeline.author: lucassaldanha

replies.bodyText: Yes, the public changes have been commited at the end of the wrapped block processor.
replies.author: pinges

replies.bodyText: ... but the block has not been added to the chain yet. That is happening later.
replies.author: pinges
